thread.title: Should Panthers look at DE Jared Odrick to solve pass-rush problem? | Panthers Wire
thread.title_full: Should Panthers look at DE Jared Odrick to solve pass-rush problem? | Panthers Wire

author: Matthew Stevens
title: Should Panthers look at DE Jared Odrick to solve pass-rush problem? | Panthers Wire
text:
Should Panthers look at DE Jared Odrick to solve pass-rush problem? Should Panthers look at DE Jared Odrick to solve pass-rush problem? By Matthew Stevens 16 hours ago Follow @MatthewS_Car 183 shares By: Matthew Stevens | 16 hours ago Follow @MatthewS_Car 
The Carolina Panthers might have finished among the top teams in the NFL at rushing the quarterback last season, but for the first half of the year, it was rough going. It eventually took defensive end Mario Addison stepping up and leading the way before Carolina found its groove. 
Now with Addison and veteran defensive end Charles Johnson set to be free agents this offseason, a large bit of their pass-rushing talent could leave. The Panthers will have to address that this offseason, even if just re-signing their own and adding some outside talent. One option in free agency could be the recently released Jared Odrick . Related: Victor Cruz: Panthers' visit 'went well' 
At only 29 years old, Odrick likely has a few more seasons of high production left in the tank. As an all-around defensive lineman than can play at defensive end or defensive tackle, Odrick has versatility that Carolinaâ€™s defense could use right now with so much likely changing over the next few seasons. 
Odrick had injury trouble last season, allowing him to only play in six games. However, when healthy for the Jacksonville Jaguars, Odrick counted for 29 tackles, 5.5 sacks, three passes defended and a forced fumble. If signed to a more cap-friendly deal than the $7 million he was originally owed in 2017, Odrick could be a great pickup. Related: Monday Mailbag: Talking Victor Cruz, Dalvin Cook and free agency 
With an estimated $47.4 million in available cap space, according to Over The Cap , the Panthers have more than enough room for a fair contract for Odrick. The move also looks to be the typical value-based signing typically attributed to general manager Dave Gettleman.
